summary: One laptop contained several hundred audiology tests. The data on the laptop containing the audiology tests was limited to the patients name, audiology test, and possibly date of birth. The data on the stolen computer did not contain the patients address, social security number, health insurance information, nor any other medical information. The second laptop contained approximately 20-30 CT scans for individual patients. The medical information contained on the second laptop included the patients name, date of birth and health care information related to the CT scan, but it did not include the patients address nor social security number. Last, the camera contained close-up digital photographs of some patients medical conditions. No other personal or medical information was included on the camera or in the images. Further, patient charts and medical information stored on ENT Partners secure server were not affected.
